mods.abstract: Photograph showing cross-section samples of corn.
mods.note: Compare photograph to the following publication. Edgerton, C.W. & Spencer, F.W. (1921, August) Selecting Corn for the Fairs. Extension Circular, No. 48, p. 3. Photograph is captioned, "Fig. 1 - A good and an inferior ear of corn. Compare the big, deep kernels of the good ear with the short, small kernels of the other."; The following article explains how corn exhibits are created and judged at the State Fair. Dodson, W.R. & Roy, V.L. (1909, August) Corn. Louisiana Bulletin, No. 118, pp. 15-16. Retrieved August 4, 2014, from http://books.google.com/books?id=8e02AQAAIAAJ&pg=RA1-PA121&lpg=RA1-PA121&dq=1909+Louisiana+State+Fair+Premium+Corn+winner&source=bl&ots=-uSG1vQsdi&sig=4_b6BFBW0kw0wlkAjhZh6W5U28&hl=en&sa=X&ei=LkLEU9mRBLSJ8gH_mYGIBQ&ved=0CDMQ6AEwAw#v=onepage&q=1909%20Louisiana%20State%20Fair%20Premium%20Corn%20winner&f=false
